document_content.title: Referral Letter for Further Evaluation of Persistent Fatigue

sections.heading: Reason for Referral
sections.content: Ms. Jenna Alvarez is being referred to Internal Medicine for evaluation of persistent fatigue and generalized malaise that has not resolved with initial management in primary care.

sections.heading: History of Present Illness
sections.content: The patient reports a 4-month history of progressive fatigue, which she describes as constant and interfering with daily activities. She denies recent infections, significant weight loss, or fevers. She has experienced mild headaches and occasional dizziness. Sleep quality is poor despite good sleep hygiene. No recent travel or known exposures.

sections.heading: Past Medical History
sections.content: No history of chronic illnesses. No previous surgeries. No known allergies.

sections.heading: Medications
sections.content: Currently taking daily multivitamin and occasional acetaminophen for headaches.

sections.heading: Social History
sections.content: Non-smoker, does not consume alcohol or illicit drugs. Works as a graphic designer. Lives with partner and two children.

sections.heading: Family History
sections.content: Mother with hypothyroidism; father with hypertension.

sections.heading: Examination Findings
sections.content: Vital signs within normal limits. No pallor, jaundice, or lymphadenopathy. Cardiovascular, respiratory, and abdominal exams unremarkable. Neurological exam normal.

sections.heading: Investigations
sections.content: Recent laboratory workup including CBC, TSH, and basic metabolic panel within normal limits. Iron studies pending.

sections.heading: Summary and Request
sections.content: Given the persistence of symptoms and unremarkable initial workup, further evaluation by Internal Medicine is requested to rule out underlying systemic causes. Please advise regarding additional investigations or management recommendations.
